meaningMnemonic: You <radical>say</radical> something to a <radical>boot</radical> when you want to be <kanji>humble</kanji>. You're down there because you're bowing in front of the person you're humbling yourself before. Because of that, your face is really close to their boots and you're speaking directly at them, instead of at the person's face, so it's more <kanji>discreet</kanji>.
readingMnemonic: You're being <kanji>humble</kanji> like this because those boots belong to the <reading>Kin</reading>g (きん) of England. You can't just say whatever you want at eye level to a king. He'll have your head chopped off for insolence, or worse!
